events.title: Indonesia takes action against mining firms after floods devastate population of world’s rarest ape
events.description: Conservationists hail the ‘desperately needed’ measures and urge greater protection after up to 11% of endangered Tapanuli orangutans wiped out The floods and landslides that tore through Indonesia’s fragile Batang Toru ecosystem in November 2024 – killing up to 11% of the world’s Tapanuli orangutan population – prompted widespread scrutiny of the extractive companies operating in the area at the time of the ecological catastrophe. For weeks, investigators searched for evidence that the companies may have damaged the Batang Toru and Garoga watersheds before the disaster, which washed torrents of mud and logs into villages, claiming the lives of more than 1,100 people . Continue reading...

events.title: Minneapolis: Victim's family calls for "truth"
events.description: The parents of Alex Jeffrey Pretti, who was shot dead by a US Border Patrol officer in Minneapolis on Saturday, issued a written statement decrying top Trump administration officials who suggested their son was a “domestic terrorist”. They remembered their son, an ICU nurse, as a man dedicated to caring for others and a compassionate advocate for social justice. France24 International Affairs commentator Douglas Herbert tells us more.

events.title: Severe storm hits half of the United States: 400,000 without power
events.description: Thousands of U.S. flights scheduled for the weekend were canceled as a massive storm began battering large swaths of the country on Saturday, cutting power and turning major highways treacherous with ice, while heavy snow, sleet, and freezing rain threatened nearly 180 million people - more than half the population - along a corridor from the southern Rocky Mountains to New England, prompting the National Weather Service to warn of several days of bitter cold and caution that the slow-melting snow and ice would significantly hamper recovery efforts. Public Policy Expert specialising in Urban Affairs and Crisis Management based in Montreal, Guillaume Lavoie, shares his insights on the issue.

events.title: ‘Singing for Stolen Children’  Escaping Russian Abduction. A Ukrainian teeenager’s account.
events.description: France 24's Gavin Lee is joined by Liza, a teenager who escaped Russia after being forcibly displaced from Ukraine. Around 20,000 children have been taken from their homes and sent to Russia or occupied territories. The International Criminal Court has issued an arrest warrant for President Putin over charges of unlawful deportation. While the Kremlin calls it a "humanitarian evacuation," independent investigators continue to uncover the truth. Nearly 1,900 children have been returned, but many remain missing. Liza, part of the Ukrainian music group Daughters of Donbass, shares her remarkable story.

events.title: Narratives clash after Trump and victim's family react to second Minneapolis shooting
events.description: Narratives clashed over shooting death of Minneapolis nurse Alex Pretti this weekend, with the Trump administration calling him a "domestic terrorist."

events.title: Anti-ICE agitator allegedly bites off federal officer's finger during Minneapolis attack
events.description: A federal officer allegedly lost a finger after a protester bit it off during Minneapolis riots. The Minnesota National Guard was mobilized as violence escalates.

events.title: Alex Pretti shooting: Right-wing media campaigns 'placed a target' on Minneapolis
events.description: Elliott Edsall, a PhD candidate at the University of Minnesota, tells FRANCE 24 about the outrage and frustration felt by Minneapolis residents after the fatal shooting of 37-year-old nurse Alex Pretti by federal immigration agents, which has sparked angry protests in a city already shaken by another shooting death weeks earlier. He discusses the political and historical elements behind the Trump administration's standoff with the left-leaning city, where thousands of federal immigration agents have been deployed.

events.title: UN warns of rising internet shutdowns as digital blackouts spread worldwide
events.description: A rising trend towards government-enforced internet shutdowns – with at least 300 incidents in more than 54 countries over the last two years – is prompting renewed warnings from the UN about the threat these digital blackouts pose to freedom of expression, access to information and human rights.

events.title: Heavy snow and rainfall kill 61, injure 110 over 3 days in Afghanistan
events.description: Dozens were killed and hundreds homes destroyed, according to the country's disaster management authority, in storms impacting 15 of Afghanistan's 34 provinces.

events.title: Heavy snow and rain kill 61, injure 110 over 3 days in Afghanistan, authorities say
events.description: Heavy snow and rainfall over the past three days have killed more than 60 people and injured over 100 across Afghanistan, the country’s disaster management authority says, as authorities in the impoverished country struggle to open roads and gain acces...

events.title: Uganda’s president calls opponents 'terrorists' in victory speech
events.description: Yoweri Museveni wins seventh term but poll criticised by observers and rights groups over repression of opposition and internet blackout Uganda’s president, Yoweri Museveni, fresh from winning a seventh term in office at 81, said on Sunday that the opposition were “terrorists” who had tried to use violence to overturn the election results. Official results showed Museveni winning a landslide with 72% of the vote , but the poll was criticised by African election observers and rights groups due to the heavy repression of the opposition and an internet blackout. Continue reading...

events.title: World News in Brief: Iran in the Human Rights Council, Myanmar election ‘fraud’, migration chief in Cyprus, Mozambique flood update
events.description: Disturbing details continued to emerge on Friday about Iran’s State-led crackdown against mass protests, while UN rights chief Volker Türk expressed deep concern that demonstrators could be executed.

events.title: After Trump strikes Islamist terrorists, US general travels to Nigeria with militants 'on the run'
events.description: Lt. Gen. John Brennan details U.S. military support helping Nigerian forces combat Islamic State and Boko Haram terrorists following strikes that disrupted terror networks.

events.title: Indonesian rescuers struggle amid search for dozens missing after deadly landslide
events.description: Indonesian rescuers are struggling with mounds of mud and water‑soaked ground as they search for dozens still missing after a landslide triggered by torrential rains on the country's main island of Java killed at least 11 people the previous day

events.title: Another Christian community at risk in Africa as extremists and war take their toll
events.description: Sudan's civil war has reportedly killed 150,000 people and displaced 13 million as Christians face daily terror. Government forces allegedly killed 11 Christians on Christmas Day.

events.title: Minneapolis: Alex Pretti's family slams Trump admin 'lies'
events.description: Protests continue in Minneapolis despite Arctic cold as the family of Alex Pretti slams the Trump administration's efforts to paint him as a "domestic terrorist" bent on killing border control agents. DW has the latest.

events.title: Videos of fatal Alex Pretti shooting in Minneapolis contradict government statements
events.description: Video footage recorded by several witnesses to the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis on Saturday shows that the 37-year-old nurse was holding a phone when he was pinned to the ground and shot, contradicting the claims of senior Trump administration officials who said Pretti “approached” officers with a gun.

events.title: A new world order? Sweden's former foreign minister on the U.S. rupture
events.description: The Trump administration’s unapologetic stance on territorial expansion and the plunder of resources goes hand in hand with its rejection of the postwar global order and its disdain for European nations perceived as being in civilisational decline. Historians warn it also harks back to an age of colonial land grabs and great-power rivalry that ultimately led to catastrophic wars. Former Minister for Foreign Affairs of Sweden, Ann Linde, shares her insights on the topic. Rating Europe's response

events.title: Iran warns any attack will mean 'all-out war' after Trump says US 'armada' on its way
events.description: A senior Iranian official has warned that the country will treat any attack "as an all-out war against us" ahead of the arrival of a US aircraft carrier strike group and other assets in the region.

events.title: Iran unveils mural warning of retaliation if US conducts a military strike
events.description: Authorities in Iran have unveiled a new mural in a central Tehran square with a direct warning to the United States to not attempt a military strike on the country

events.title: US withdrawal from WHO ‘risks global safety’, agency says in detailed rebuttal
events.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) has issued a detailed statement regretting the United States decision to leave the UN agency, and declaring that it will leave both the US and the world less safe as a result.

events.title: ‘Brazen’ political influence of rich laid bare as wealth of billionaires reaches $18.3tn, says Oxfam
events.description: Governments opting for oligarchy while brutally repressing protests over austerity and lack of jobs, charity report says The world saw a record number of billionaires created last year, with a collective wealth of $18.3tn (£13.7tn), while global efforts stalled in the fight against poverty and hunger. Oxfam’s annual survey of global inequality has revealed that the number of billionaires surpassed 3,000 for the first time during 2025. Since 2020, their collective wealth grew by 81%, or $8.2tn, which the charity claims would be enough to eradicate global poverty 26 times over. Continue reading...

events.title: Hotel fire in Pakistan's eastern city of Lahore leaves 3 dead, 8 others injured
events.description: A fire in the basement of a hotel in Pakistan’s eastern city of Lahore has killed three people and injured eight others, officials said

events.title: Envoys from US meet Netanyahu as Israel continues to bomb Gaza
events.description: Medical sources say at least three Palestinians have been killed and many wounded throughout the day in Israeli attacks.

events.title: Wave of Israeli attacks kills two in Lebanon in latest ceasefire violation
events.description: Deadly Israeli air strikes target areas across south Lebanon and the Bekaa Valley amid simmering regional tensions.

events.title: New Zealand landslide: rescue efforts called off for six people buried in disaster
events.description: Rescue efforts at Mount Maunganui site switch to recovery operation that police say could take several days Efforts to rescue six people buried by a landslide at a New Zealand holiday park ended on Saturday, with police shifting into a recovery operation. Police Supt Tim Anderson said human remains had been uncovered on Friday night beneath the mountains of dirt and debris that crashed into a campsite in Mount Maunganui on Thursday, adding that it could take several days to locate all of the victims due to the unstable ground. Continue reading...

events.title: Two dead and six missing after landslides hit house and campground in New Zealand
events.description: Search-and-rescue teams worked through the night at the campground, but there had been no progress in finding missing people, officials say New Zealand is ‘full of grief”, the prime minister has said, after landslides tore through a house and busy campground, leaving two dead and at least six victims still missing. Police said emergency crews were still searching for at least six people, including two teenagers, believed missing beneath the debris of a landslide which struck a Mount Maunganui campsite on Thursday morning. Police were attempting to contact another three people. Families enjoying the summer school holiday were among the campers. Recreational vehicles and at least one structure were crushed, images showed. Continue reading...

events.title: At Davos, U.S. allies question a fraying world order
events.description: It was a volatile week for trans-Atlantic relations, marked by President Trump statements that unsettled global markets and strained ties with U.S. allies — on topics ranging from Greenland to Gaza.

events.title: UN rights chief decries US treatment of migrants, as deaths in ICE custody rise
events.description: The UN’s top human rights official has raised alarm over what he described as the growing dehumanisation of migrants in the United States, warning that current immigration enforcement practices are undermining due process, family unity and basic human dignity.

events.title: UN Assembly president defends multilateralism, UN Charter in Davos
events.description: From Davos, the President of the UN General Assembly on Wednesday warned that the world has entered a “make‑or‑break” moment for multilateralism, saying the rules‑based order can survive only if states speak the truth and act when it’s hard. She called for a cross‑regional alliance to push back against growing lawlessness, disinformation, and power‑based politics.

events.title: Lindsey Graham says there's 'strong consensus' to protect Kurds as Syrian forces advance on territory
events.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham and former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo warn of dire threats to Syrian Kurds as Syrian forces attack Kurdish-controlled territory in northern Syria.

events.title: Protests in Iran: Official casualty figures in doubt
events.description: The number of people killed in the brutal suppression of protests in Iran remains unclear, with reports that the injured are avoiding medical assistance out of fear.

events.title: “An electrical ceasefire is needed”: warnings as Russia targets Ukraine’s power grid
events.description: Russia’s strikes have hit Ukraine’s power infrastructure, leaving many communities without heat and electricity. For more, France 24’s Catherine Viette is joined by Peter Zalmayev from the Eurasia Democracy Initiative.

events.title: World News in Brief: Winter attacks in Ukraine, looming food aid cuts in Nigeria, drought in Kenya
events.description: Russian forces launched a fresh wave of strikes across Ukraine this week which have left hundreds of thousands of families without electricity and heating amid freezing temperatures.

events.title: Gaza: War crimes probe pledges to continue work for justice and accountability
events.description: As President Trump launched the international Board of Peace plan for Gaza on Thursday, top independent rights experts tasked by the UN Human Rights Council with investigating grave abuses linked to the Hamas-Israel war pledged to continue their work seeking justice and accountability for all.

events.title: What we know about fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis
events.description: Trump officials says federal agents shot in self-defence, as Pretti's parents accuse them of "sickening lies".

events.title: Advantage China: Trump’s tantrums push US allies closer to Beijing
events.description: In the search for stability, some western nations are turning to a country that many in Washington see as an existential threat If geopolitics relies at least in part on bonhomie between global leaders, China made an unexpected play for Ireland’s good graces when the taoiseach visited Beijing this month. Meeting Ireland’s leader, Micheál Martin, in the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, China’s president, Xi Jinping, said a favourite book of his as a teenager was The Gadfly, by the Irish author Ethel Voynich, a novel set in the revolutionary fervour of Italy in the 1840s. “It was unusual that we ended up discussing The Gadfly and its impact on both of us but there you are,” Martin told reporters in Beijing. Continue reading...

events.title: Mass blackouts hit Kyiv: Resident describes living in freezing temperatures and without electricity
events.description: As President Zelensky says today that peace talks are progressing and that a U.S. security guarantee is “100 percent there,” awaiting only formal approval from President Trump, there has so far been no confirmation from the White House, nor does it address President Putin’s continued insistence on claiming more Ukrainian territory; meanwhile, away from the front lines, civilians are bearing the brunt of the war, with some left without electricity for more than 16 days, prompting Ukraine’s foreign minister to describe repeated attacks on the energy grid as acts of genocide, as we now turn to the left bank to hear from resident Olena Zviahina, who describes the damage to her building, the freezing conditions inside her apartment, how she keeps warm, what support—if any—is available from neighbors or authorities, how long she believes she can endure these conditions, whether she plans to stay, and whether people around her believe a ceasefire is near or that Russia’s demand for the Donbas could bring an end to the war.

events.title: The week in pictures: Outrage in Minneapolis, delight in Dakar – and Macron's shades
events.description: The fatal shooting of a man in Minneapolis by a federal immigration agent sparked renewed outrage in the US on a week that saw revellers line the streets of Dakar to celebrate Senegal's Africa Cup of Nations title and France's Emmanuel Macron steal the show at the annual Davos gathering with his widely discussed Top Gun-style aviator sunglasses. FRANCE 24 looks back at the week's most striking images.

events.title: UK plans to create 'British FBI' to bring national probes under single police force
events.description: The British government plans to unveil a new national police force, dubbed the "British FBI," to handle complex investigations like counterterrorism and fraud

events.title: Haiti crisis at breaking point as gangs tighten grip ahead of transition deadline
events.description: Haiti’s deepening crisis has reached a critical phase, senior UN officials warned the Security Council on Wednesday, as powerful gangs continue to expand their control across the country.

events.title: How the Oct 7 Hamas terror attacks exposed long-running concerns about UNRWA, new film charges
events.description: Tracing UNRWA from 1949 to today, the film examines refugee policy, weak oversight and alleged links to Hamas control in Gaza, raising questions about the agency’s role and accountability.

events.title: People cling to treetops as 'worst floods in a generation' sweep Mozambique
events.description: The worst flooding in a generation hits Mozambique with teams from Brazil, South Africa and the UK helping with the rescue.

events.title: Tragic chapter on the trains sends rail superpower Spain into crisis
events.description: Spain's vaunted reputation for its high-speed network has been humbled by disaster on the railways.

events.title: ‘It’s the sovereignty of the country’: Guinea-Bissau says US vaccine study suspended
events.description: Despite US pushback, officials in west Africa say controversial hepatitis B study on pause amid ethics concerns US health officials insisted it was still on. African health leaders said it was cancelled . At the heart of the controversy is the west African nation of Guinea-Bissau – one of the poorest countries in the world and the proposed site of a hotly debated US-funded study on vaccines. The study on hepatitis B vaccination, to be led by Danish researchers, became a flashpoint after major changes to the US vaccination schedule and prompted questions about how research is conducted ethically in other countries. Continue reading...

events.title: Thousands protest in Paris over death of immigrant worker in police custody
events.description: Thousands of people marched in Paris on Sunday in protest at the death in police custody of 35-year-old El Hacen Diarra, whose violent arrest on January 14 was caught on camera. Paris police have launched an internal investigation into what happened, but Interior Minister Laurent Nunez has rejected calls for the officers concerned to be suspended.

events.title: Iran's Revolutionary Guard commander warns the US, says his force has its 'finger on the trigger'
events.description: The commander of Iran’s paramilitary Revolutionary Guard, a force which was key in putting down recent nationwide protests in a crackdown that left thousands dead, says the force is “more ready than ever, finger on the trigger.”

events.title: College soccer star, girlfriend dead as illegal immigrant’s record ignites lawmaker fury statewide
events.description: Fatal North Carolina crash allegedly caused by repeat DUI offender sparks heated debate over sanctuary policies and immigration enforcement failures.

events.title: Iran accused of sex assaults on teenage prisoners, while families charged to recover remains of loved ones
events.description: Iran's prosecutor general Mohammad Movahedi claims government crushed nationwide protests as death toll reaches 544 with over 10,681 arrested.

events.title: Winter storm leaves over a million customers without power across US
events.description: From Texas to New England, the monster storm brings hazardous conditions, prompting warnings to stay off roads.

events.title: ActionAid to rethink child sponsorship as part of plan to ‘decolonise’ its work
events.description: Development charity’s new co-chief executives signal shift from controversial sponsor a child scheme launched in 1972 to long-term grassroots funding Child sponsorship schemes that allow donors to handpick children to support in poor countries can carry racialised, paternalistic undertones and need to be transformed, the newly appointed co-chief executives of ActionAid UK said as they set out to “decolonise” the organisation’s work. ActionAid began in 1972 by finding sponsors for schoolchildren in India and Kenya, but Taahra Ghazi and Hannah Bond have launched their co-leadership this month with the goal of shifting narratives around aid from sympathy towards solidarity and partnership with global movements. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump withdraws invitation for Canada to join his global ‘board of peace’
events.description: While leaders of many liberal democracies declined to sign on, Mark Carney had, before Davos, accepted in principle Donald Trump withdrew on Thursday an invitation for Canada to join his “board of peace” initiative aimed at resolving global conflicts. “Please let this Letter serve to represent that the Board of Peace is withdrawing its invitation to you regarding Canada’s joining, what will be, the most prestigious Board of Leaders ever assembled, at any time,” Trump wrote in a Truth Social post directed at the Canadian prime minister, Mark Carney . Continue reading...

events.title: DW correspondent arrested in Niger
events.description: A correspondent for German international broadcaster Deutsche Welle (DW) was arrested on January 23. It comes after a report published on DW Hausa last year.

events.title: Acquire territory, export culture wars: How to make sense of Trump’s ‘new imperialism’
events.description: The Trump administration’s unapologetic stance on territorial expansion and the plunder of resources goes hand in hand with its rejection of the postwar global order and its disdain for European nations perceived as being in civilisational decline. Historians warn it also harks back to an age of colonial land grabs and great-power rivalry that ultimately led to catastrophic wars.

events.title: Iran unveils mural warning US not to launch military strike
events.description: A new mural warning the US not to launch a military strike on Iran has been unveiled in a square in central Tehran.

events.title: Minnesota school board member Chauntyll Allen ripped by state lawmaker after anti-ICE church invasion arrest
events.description: Saint Paul school board member storms church with protesters, which sparked DOJ investigation after targeting pastor allegedly working as ICE agent.

events.title: Video shows moments around fatal shooting of Alex Pretti in Minneapolis
events.description: Bystander footage has captured the seconds before the killing of 37-year-old Alex Pretti.

events.title: Trump says UK soldiers in Afghanistan 'among greatest of all warriors'
events.description: The US president's praise follows his claim that allied forces avoided the front lines during the Afghanistan conflict.

events.title: 'Arctic siege': US winter storm brings frigid temperatures, cuts power to more than a million
events.description: A monster winter storm on Sunday paralyzed swathes of the United States with heavy snow and ice, leaving close to a million people in the Southeast without power. New York Governor Kathy Hochul warned that the state was bracing for the longest cold stretch and highest snow totals it has seen in years, with more snow and even lower temperatures forecast in the coming days.

events.title: 'They're killing us': Fury in Minneapolis after federal agents shoot dead nurse Alex Pretti
events.description: 'We know that they're here just to scare us and we're not gonna be afraid': Demonstrators gathered on the streets around the spot where 37-year-old Minneapolis nurse Alex Pretti was killed by border agents on Saturday. Jessica Le Masurier reports from the scene.

events.title: Dozens still missing after Indonesia landslide kills at least 25 people
events.description: Dozens of people are still missing following a landslide on Indonesia's Java island on Saturday that killed at least 25 people.

events.title: UN envoy highlights ‘window to advance peace’ in Colombia
events.description: The new year provides an opportunity for Colombia to keep advancing towards lasting peace, a decade after a landmark accord that ended more than 50 years of conflict, the UN Special Representative told the Security Council on Friday.

events.title: Alex Pretti identified as Minneapolis man fatally shot by federal immigration agent
events.description: A person in Minneapolis was reportedly shot during an interaction with Border Patrol agents. DHS tells Fox News that the suspect was armed.

events.title: Thousands march through Minneapolis, swarm Target Center demanding ICE removal from Minnesota
events.description: Anti-ICE agitators swarmed the Target Center in Minneapolis Friday, and thousands marched downtown demanding a stop to federal immigration enforcement operations in the city.

events.title: Italy’s Meloni rebukes Trump remarks on NATO’s role in Afghanistan
events.description: Italian PM Giorgia Meloni calls Trump's NATO comments about Afghanistan "unacceptable," defending Italy's sacrifice of 53 soldiers killed in the conflict.

events.title: Trump pressures UK over Hamas-linked figure as US intel flags potential terror threat
events.description: U.S. Treasury sanctioned Zaher Birawi, 64, alleging the Britain-based activist serves as a Hamas senior official through a Popular Conference for Palestinians Abroad leadership role.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Cathy Freeman leads Australia Day honours alongside enforcer of world-first social media ban
events.description: High-profile Australians celebrated alongside more than 600 civilians who have changed lives and the country Astronaut Katherine Bennell-Pegg named Australian of the Year for 2026 Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australia’s beloved Olympic sprinter Cathy Freeman has been recognised in this year’s Australia Day Honours list alongside a driving force of one of the Games’ youngest sports, skateboarding, a world-leading quantum scientist, a children’s book illustrator, rock royalty and the enforcer of Australia’s world-first social media ban. Freeman was appointed a Companion of the Order of Australia, the country’s highest civilian honour. Her sensational athletic achievements were applauded by the honours committee, which also acknowledged her social impact across the community, her work on the reconciliation movement in the spirit of unity and inclusion, and as a role model to young people. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘Cycle of attacks must end’: Lead UN official in Ukraine
events.description: The senior UN official in Ukraine, Matthias Schmale, has issued a condemnation of the massive overnight Russian drone and missile strike on several major Ukrainian cities, killing and injuring civilians, and knocking out energy infrastructure amid sub-zero temperatures.

events.title: Party backed by generals set for landslide as 'sham' Myanmar election ends
events.description: Many parties were banned and there was no voting in about half the country which is gripped by fear and civil war.

events.title: Syria: Life-saving aid reaches Kurdish city of Kobane
events.description: Following clashes in Syria, people in the Kurdish-majority Kobane are facing a "catastrophic" humanitarian situation, with activists warning they lack food, water and power.

events.title: Syria: Renewed clashes risk derailing fragile transition
events.description: A tense standoff between the Syrian Government and Kurdish-led forces in the country’s northeast risks igniting wider instability just as Syria struggles to emerge from years of conflict and authoritarian rule, senior UN officials told the Security Council on Thursday.

events.title: Four attacks in 48 hours: How east Australia's beaches became a 'perfect storm' for sharks
events.description: Human-shark encounters in Australia are rising - but experts are keen to point out it isn't the animals' fault.

events.title: Trump says ‘US armada’ moving towards Iran as tensions escalate
events.description: Trump ordered an aircraft carrier and a guided-missile strike group to the Middle East as tensions soar with Iran.

events.title: Australia news live: O’Brien claims Ley won’t face challenge for Liberal leadership; extreme heat warning for Victoria
events.description: Deputy opposition leader says he is ‘very disappointed’ by Coalition split but ‘we are where we are’. Follow today’s news live Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Nearly three-quarters of Order of Australia awards go to men, reflecting imbalance in nominations Some 680 Australians were recognised with Order of Australia awards, made up of 496 men and 184 women. There is no doubt there are as many outstanding women contributing to our communities as there are men … the council would like to see this balance reflected across all nominations and, therefore, outcomes at all levels of award. We encourage all Australians to look around their community, their workplaces and the whole of our society, identify the women, as well as the men, who make a difference and whose impact is profound and nominate them so they can be celebrated through the Order of Australia. Continue reading...

events.title: Russian strikes knock out heat in freezing Kyiv as peace talks continue
events.description: Russian strikes left much of Kyiv without heat, water and power during freezing temperature, even as Ukraine, Russia and the U.S. held talks on ending the nearly four-year war.

events.title: US winter storm: 13,000 flights canceled as temperatures dip
events.description: Millions of people hunkered down as a major winter storm pummeled much of central and eastern half of the country. Thousands of flights were canceled, and thousands reported power outages in dangerously cold conditions.

events.title: Campus Radicals: Union member tell-all, Dems back to DEI ways, more violent leftist threats on campus
events.description: Teachers union headlines, anti-Republican death threats and Virginia Democrats' new push for DEI in the classroom rounded out Campus Radicals coverage for the week.

events.title: Iran Revolutionary Guard commander says regime has 'finger on the trigger' as US warships head to Middle East
events.description: Iran's Revolutionary Guard chief warns the U.S. it has a "finger on the trigger" as American warships head to the Middle East amid anti-regime protests.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Head of US Africa bureau urges staff to highlight US ‘generosity’ despite aid cuts
events.description: Email sent to diplomats by state department office’s new boss is labelled ‘racist’ after dismissing Africa as a priority US diplomats have been encouraged to “unabashedly and aggressively” remind African governments about the “generosity” of the American people, according to a leaked email sent to staff in the US state department’s Bureau of African Affairs this January and obtained by the Guardian. “It’s not gauche to remind these countries of the American people’s generosity in containing HIV/Aids or alleviating famine,” says the email. Continue reading...

events.title: Gaza reconstruction talks must not distract from massive needs, say UN aid agencies
events.description: Amid reconstruction talks on Gaza linked to President Trump's just-launched Board of Peace, UN aid agencies insisted on Friday that what Gazans need most is immediate relief from the ongoing humanitarian catastrophe there.

events.title: New York boy, 15, missing after traveling to NYC to meet someone he met on Roblox, family says
events.description: Thomas Medlin, 15, was last seen at Grand Central in New York City on Jan. 9 after reportedly leaving Long Island to meet up with someone he met through Roblox.

events.title: Israel extends ban on Al Jazeera’s operations by 90 days
events.description: Since May 2024, Israeli law has banned the network, citing threat to national security, an allegation Al Jazeera denies.

events.title: Pentagon downplays China threat: What it means for US allies
events.description: US National Defense Strategy says Chinese threat is not a priority as Washington pivots to the Western Hemisphere.

events.title: Clashes erupt at antigovernment protest in Albanian capital Tirana
events.description: Protests turn violent, arrests are made, as opposition accuses Prime Minister Edi Rama and allies of corruption.

events.title: Trump threatens Canada with 100% tariff over possible deal with China
events.description: President also claims US refineries will process seized Venezuelan oil, saying ‘we take the oil’ Donald Trump on Saturday said he would impose a 100% tariff on all Canadian imports if the North American country makes a trade deal with China . Beside that tariff threat, another Trump foreign policy maneuver to make news on Saturday involved the president announcing the US had taken the oil that was on recently seized Venezuelan tankers. Continue reading...

events.title: Canadian Olympic snowboarder turned alleged cocaine kingpin in US custody
events.description: Ryan Wedding turned himself in at US consulate in Mexico City and is due to appear in court in California on Monday Ryan Wedding, the Canadian Olympic snowboarder turned alleged drug kingpin , has been arrested after turning himself in at the US embassy in Mexico, law enforcement officials announced on Friday. Wedding, 44, had been sought by the FBI and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) for his role in overseeing what the US attorney general, Pam Bondi , called the “one of the most prolific and violent drug-trafficking organizations” in the world. Continue reading...

events.title: US security agreement for Ukraine is '100% ready' to be signed, Zelensky says
events.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky said Sunday that a US security guarantees document for Ukraine is "100% ready" after two days of talks involving representatives from Kyiv, the US and Russia. Zelensky sought more air defence support from allies as hundreds of buildings in Ukraine's capital were without heating in subfreezing temperatures for a second day after overnight Russian strikes. Read our blog to see how the day's events unfolded.

events.title: Virginia Democrats frustrate law enforcement with bill axing prison time for violent crime, expert warns
events.description: Virginia Democrats propose eliminating minimum prison sentences for violent crimes including rape and manslaughter, sparking widespread controversy and debate.

events.title: Man who allegedly threatened to shoot ICE agents had rifles, body armor and ammo cache, feds say
events.description: An Ohio man who allegedly threatened ICE agents on social media is facing federal charges after authorities found guns and tactical gear at his home.

events.title: As the world inches back to a pre-WW2 order, the 'middle powers' face a grave new challenge
events.description: With economic stagnation and extremes of inequality comes corrosion of trust in democratic institutions. So Trump may be a symptom, not a cause, of what Carney called a "rupture" with the post-WW2 order.

events.title: What India's Republic Day red carpet means for its foreign policy
events.description: Who sits beside India’s president on Republic Day signals Delhi’s diplomatic priorities to the world.

events.title: Why is Trump upending 80 years of US foreign policy?
events.description: Former Trump official Christian Whiton argues it is about time to press ‘reset’ on US relations with the world.

events.title: Dozens supporting Palestine hunger strikers arrested at London prison
events.description: Videos show police officers shoving protesters to the ground and herding them outside Prison Wormwood Scrubs.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: UNESCO has officially added yodeling to its list of 'Intangible Cultural Heritage'
events.description: Yodeling has been officially recognized by the UN as part of the world's intangible cultural heritage.

events.title: Climber Alex Honnold scales Taipei 101 skyscraper without ropes
events.description: American climber Alex Honnold ascended one of the world's tallest buildings on Sunday without a rope or protective equipment.

events.title: Young people must be ‘truly involved’ in transforming education
events.description: With young people under 30 making up more than half of the global population and over 272 million children and youth still out of school, their participation in shaping education is becoming increasingly vital.

events.title: Eighty years at the heart of global development
events.description: From humanitarian crises and youth unemployment, to climate resilience and development financing, many of today’s global challenges pass through a single United Nations body that is quietly turning 80 this year.

events.title: For every $1 spent protecting nature, $30 goes to destroying it
events.description: The world spends billions to protect nature, but trillions are being invested in business activities that harm the environment.

events.title: Syrian militiaman shows off what he claims to be severed Kurdish fighter's braid as Damascus asserts control
events.description: A video of a Syrian fighter holding a braid he claims was taken from a Kurdish woman in Raqqa sparked outrage and protests as Damascus expands control amid a fragile ceasefire.

events.title: Kenya's ex-deputy president alleges assassination attempt in church attack
events.description: The interior minister condemned the attack, which police say they are investigating.

events.title: Germany arrests suspected Hamas member over alleged attack plot
events.description: The Lebanese man helped plan attacks on Jewish and Israeli institutions in Europe, prosecutors say.

events.title: US military moves Navy, Air Force assets to the Middle East: What to know
events.description: Trump says US 'armada' is heading towards the Gulf, raising fears of a military escalation in the region.

events.title: Cornel West: US is facing moral collapse and democratic decay
events.description: Academic and activist discusses what he sees as moral collapse in US and leadership crisis in the Democratic Party.

events.title: ‘Invoking Insurrection Act would escalate conflict with private citizens’
events.description: ‘Invoking US Insurrection Act would escalate conflict with private citizens’

events.title: Myanmar holds final stage of disputed election as rebels continue fighting
events.description: Myanmar’s final stage of its disputed general election is under way despite the ongoing civil war.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Outsourced call centre staff at NDIS have to pretend to work for government, workers say
events.description: Serco employees also say they are given email addresses identical to public servants, making them indistinguishable Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Outsourced call centre staff on the national disability insurance scheme (NDIS) phone lines must pretend to be public servants, according to workers, and are responsible for deciding which funding requests are prioritised despite having no specialised welfare training. Workers at Serco, a major outsource provider, have also been issued government agency email addresses, making it impossible for the public to tell them apart from direct employees despite vast differences in their pay, conditions, training and support. Continue reading...

events.title: Astronaut Katherine Bennell-Pegg named Australian of the Year for 2026
events.description: Bennell-Pegg tells ceremony in Canberra she hopes to use award to inspire young people to chase their dreams Cathy Freeman leads Australia Day 2026 honours list Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast As a girl, Katherine Bennell-Pegg would lie on the dry grass in her backyard, gazing up at the stars and dreaming about one day reaching them. While she’s yet to enter space, the now-41-year-old is closer than most could ever hope for. Continue reading...

events.title: Dingoes on Australia’s K’gari island to be euthanised after death of Canadian tourist Piper James
events.description: Queensland government says pack linked to 19-year-old’s death pose ‘unacceptable public safety risk’ as Indigenous traditional owners say they were not consulted The dingo pack linked to the death of Canadian tourist Piper James on Australian island K’gari will be destroyed, the Queensland government has announced. Environment minister Andrew Powell said on Sunday that an entire pack of 10 animals would be euthanised. Continue reading...

events.title: A Canadian Olympic snowboarder turned alleged drug kingpin is arrested in Mexico
events.description: Ryan Wedding was among the FBI's top fugitives and faces charges related to drug trafficking and the killing of a federal witness. He reportedly turned himself in at the U.S. embassy in Mexico

events.title: Myanmar opens final round of controversial election
events.description: Myanmar began the final phase of its month-long election on Sunday, just a week short of the fifth anniversary of the military coup, with the dominant pro-military party heading toward what appears to be a landslide victory in a junta-run vote, one that critics argue will only serve to entrench the army’s hold on power. Liza Kaminov tells us more.

events.title: Aftermath challenges daily life in Syria
events.description: The withdrawal of the Kurdish-led SDF from northeastern Syria represents the most significant shift in control in the country since the fall of longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad, according to reports from D. Alboz, H. Hammoud and Liza Kaminov.

events.title: 'Barbaric' attack during Ukraine peace talks - but 'unexpected chemistry' raises hopes
events.description: Fresh talks between the US, Russia and Ukraine could take place "as early as next week", President Zelenskyy has said.

events.title: Boy, 12, dies after shark attack in Sydney Harbour
events.description: An Australian boy attacked by a shark in Sydney Harbour has died in hospital, his family has announced.

events.title: Wife of Uganda's opposition leader recounts how armed men attacked her at her home
events.description: Armed men have attacked the home of Ugandan opposition leader Bobi Wine, targeting his wife, Barbara Kyagulanyi

events.title: Keeping people warm amid hostilities and harsh winter weather in Ukraine
events.description: As people in war-torn Ukraine face the coldest winter in more than a decade, authorities and humanitarians are working to help them stay warm, particularly the most vulnerable residents.

events.title: Deputy saves mail driver from burning truck in Washington: bodycam
events.description: Washington deputy saves mail truck driver from burning wreckage after collision. Bystander helps extinguish flames in dramatic rescue caught on camera.

events.title: Alex Pretti, 37, identified as man fatally shot by Border Patrol agent in Minneapolis
events.description: A Border Patrol agent fatally shot Minneapolis ICU nurse Alex Jeffrey Pretti during an immigration operation in Minneapolis on Saturday.

events.title: Parents’ relentless hunt for missing daughter heats up as new technology breathes life into case
events.description: Jennifer Kesse's parents refuse to give up searching for their daughter 20 years after she disappeared in Orlando. New AI technology brings hope.

events.title: Zelenskyy touts ‘constructive’ trilateral talks between the US, Russia and Ukraine in Abu Dhabi
events.description: Ukraine's Zelenskyy calls recent US-Russia-Ukraine talks in Abu Dhabi "constructive," marking potential breakthrough in diplomatic efforts to end the war.

events.title: Boy, 12, dies after shark attack while swimming at popular cliff-jumping spot: 'We are heartbroken'
events.description: Nico Antic, 12, died from injuries after a shark attack at Sydney Harbour's Jump Rock. Friends heroically pulled him to safety after the attack.

events.title: Russia, Ukraine to discuss territory as Trump says both sides 'want to make a deal'
events.description: Abu Dhabi hosts trilateral meeting with the U.S., Ukraine and Russia in a possible sign that the nearly four-year war could be coming to an end.

events.title: Canadian PM Carney fires back at Trump over claim that 'Canada lives because of the United States'
events.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney rejected President Donald Trump's claim that "Canada lives because of the United States," declaring Canada "thrives because we are Canadian."

events.title: Pentagon to reduce its role in deterrence of North Korea
events.description: US policy document suggests South Korea take primary responsibility, as Pentagon prioritises defending US homeland The Pentagon foresees a “more limited” role in deterring North Korea, with South Korea taking primary responsibility for the task, a Pentagon policy document released on Friday said, in a move likely to raise concern in Seoul. South Korea hosts about 28,500 US troops in combined defence against North Korea’s military threat and Seoul has raised its defence budget by 7.5% for this year. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump threatens Canada with 100% tariffs over its new trade deal with China
events.description: The announcement is a reversal for Trump, who initially initially praised the agreement with China as something Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney "should be doing."

events.title: Mamdani announces remote school day due to dangerous winter storm conditions
events.description: NYC Mayor Mamdani cites safety concerns from winter storm in decision for public schools to go remote on Monday.

events.title: Virginia Democrats blasted for threatening historic military college VMI with funding threat over DEI concerns
events.description: Virginia Democrats introduce resolution to investigate VMI funding as Governor Spanberger faces criticism for DEI push at historic military college.

events.title: What’s behind the recent shift in US defence strategy?
events.description: Washington has revealed its new national defence strategy.

events.title: What al-Maliki’s return would mean for Iraq and the region
events.description: Nouri al-Maliki's third term as prime minister is likely to escalate sectarian politics in the country.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Spanish prosecutors drop sexual assault complaint against Julio Iglesias
events.description: Court says alleged abuse and trafficking offences occurred outside Spain, leaving it without jurisdiction Spanish prosecutors have shelved a complaint brought by two women who have accused the singer Julio Iglesias of sexual assault and human trafficking , arguing the country’s courts have no jurisdiction as the alleged offences took place outside Spain. Two female former employees who worked at Iglesias’s Caribbean mansions 10 days ago accused the veteran entertainer of sexual assault, saying they had been subjected “to inappropriate touching, insults and humiliation … in an atmosphere of control and constant harassment”. Continue reading...

events.title: Junta-backed party poised to win Myanmar elections
events.description: Myanmar's junta chief Min Aung Hlaing is widely expected to take on the country's presidency after the highly controversial elections.

events.title: Syria opens humanitarian corridor to Kurdish town of Kobane after ceasefire extended
events.description: The United Nations' refugee agency on Sunday said trucks carrying aid were headed for Kobane after the Syrian military agreed to open a humanitarian corridor to the Kurdish-majority town surrounded by government forces and the Turkish border. The opening of the corridor comes a day after Syrian and Kurdish forces extended a ceasefire agreement by 15 days.

events.title: DHS says illegal immigrant accused of throwing rock at New Jersey school bus, injuring young girl
events.description: A New Jersey man accused of throwing a rock at a school bus and seriously injuring an 8-year-old girl is in the country illegally, according to the Department of Homeland Security.

events.title: Cyclist wins Australia race despite being knocked off by Kangaroo
events.description: Australian Jay Vine wins the Tour Down Under - despite being knocked off his bike in a crash caused by a kangaroo.

events.title: Trump threatens Canada with 100% tariffs if it 'makes a deal with China'
events.description: It comes as tensions appear to have escalated between Trump and Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney.

events.title: Manchester United dent Arsenal’s title bid with dramatic 3-2 win
events.description: Matheus Cunha's superb late strike clinches a thrilling 3-2 away win for United against the Premier League leaders.

events.title: Outrage after US agents kill ICU nurse Alex Pretti in Minnesota
events.description: Authorities say Alex Pretti posed a violent threat when shot by US ICE agents, but multiple videos suggest otherwise.

events.title: Leaked video shows Venezuela regime’s desperate struggle to control message
events.description: Interim leader Delcy Rodríguez told influencers of US threat to kill leaders if they did not cooperate after capture of Maduro The communications minister holds a phone up to a microphone before a gathering of regime-friendly influencers. On speakerphone is Venezuela’s acting president, Delcy Rodríguez , who claims that when US forces captured the dictator Nicolás Maduro , she and other members of his cabinet were given 15 minutes to decide whether to comply with Washington’s demands – “or they would kill us”. Continue reading...

events.title: China's top general under investigation in latest military purge
events.description: Analysts believe these purges aim to reform the military and ensure loyalty to Chinese leader Xi Jinping. Another commission member, Liu Zhenli, is also under investigation.

events.title: Germany news: Majority see Trump as threat to nation
events.description: A new poll finds more than 60% of Germans see the US president as a major threat. It comes as the president's actions and rhetoric have alienated US allies. Follow DW here for the latest.

events.title: Donald Trump threatens 100% tariff on Ottawa
events.description: Donald Trump has threatened Canada with 100% tariffs if it signs a trade deal with China, its second-largest trading partner after the U.S., marking the latest escalation in U.-Canada relations, which have been further strained after Mark Carney criticized Trump’s Greenland takeover threats at the Davos Forum and urged “middle powers” to unite. Shirli Sitbon tells us more.

events.title: Ceasefire with Kurdish-led force extended for another 15 days, Syrian army says
events.description: Hours after the expiration of a four-day truce between the Syrian government and Kurdish-led fighters Saturday, Syria’s defense ministry announced the ceasefire had been extended by another 15 days

events.title: ‘Dangerous nostalgia’ is a threat to multilateralism, UN deputy chief tells Danish MPs
events.description: United Nations Deputy Secretary-General Amina Mohammed urged countries to protect the UN Charter in a powerful speech to the Danish Parliament on Thursday, urging countries to “stand up for a rules-based order” – or pay the price.

events.title: More than 15,000 US flights have now been disrupted by America’s massive winter storm
events.description: Massive winter storm triggers over 15,000 flight disruptions as U.S. braces for historic winter weather with more than 190 million Americans in the storm's path.

events.title: China's top general ousted, placed under investigation in latest military purge
events.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping removed China's top general Zhang Youxia amid an investigation for violating party discipline in latest military purge.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Baghdad says it will prosecute Islamic State militants being moved from Syria to Iraq
events.description: Baghdad says it will prosecute and try militants from the Islamic State group who are being transferred from prisons and detention camps in neighboring Syria to Iraq under a U.S.-brokered deal

events.title: Pakistani human rights lawyers jailed for 17 years over social media posts
events.description: A Pakistani court has sentenced a lawyer couple to 17 years in prison each over social media posts authorities said were hostile to the state and its security institutions

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Blood supplies running low in Germany
events.description: A shortage of blood donations in Germany could have dramatic consequences. The situation was critical in mid-January. DW's Marcel Fürstenau answered a call to donate blood and reported on his experience.

events.title: Limited access restored to Syria’s Al Hol camp amid security concerns
events.description: United Nations agencies have regained limited access to Syria’s Al Hol camp and resumed the delivery of essential supplies after days of disruption caused by a volatile security situation, the UN Deputy Spokesperson said on Friday.

events.title: Iran's top prosecutor criticizes Trump's announcement that 800+ executions were halted: 'Completely false'
events.description: Iran’s top prosecutor Mohammad Movahedi is criticizing an announcement from President Donald Trump that Iran recently canceled more than 800 executions.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Who was Alex Pretti, the intensive care nurse shot dead in Minneapolis?
events.description: He has been described as an avid outdoorsman who loved mountain biking.

events.title: Venezuela frees dozens of political prisoners, human rights group says
events.description: It is the latest batch of detainees freed since the US seized Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro in a raid.

events.title: Captain of suspected Russian shadow tanker in French custody
events.description: French officials seized the tanker, named the Grinch, in the Mediterranean Sea on Thursday.

events.title: Climber Alex Honnold scales 101-floor skyscraper without safety gear
events.description: Alex Honnold has become the first person to climb the Taiwanese building alone without safety equipment.

events.title: Sir Mark Tully, the BBC's 'voice of India', dies aged 90
events.description: Sir Mark covered some of the defining moments in India's history in a career that spanned decades.

events.title: Cosmetic doctor sorry for picking apart singer Troye Sivan's looks on TikTok
events.description: The singer hit out at Dr Zayn Khalid Majeed - who says he will try to have a positive impact with his content.

events.title: How Soviet urban planning is helping Russia freeze Ukraine
events.description: Thousands of people are affected when heating plants are targeted by Russian forces.

events.title: Hamas says gave Israel, mediators details about last Gaza captive’s remains
events.description: Israeli forces are searching Gaza cemetery for the remains of Ran Gvili, the last captive in the Palestinian territory.

events.title: Bangladesh slams India over fugitive ex-PM Hasina’s first public address
events.description: Dhaka says it is 'shocked' the ousted leader was allowed to speak at news conference, her first since the 2024 uprising.

events.title: Arsenal vs Manchester United 2-3: Premier League – as it happened
events.description: All the updates as United shock Arsenal with stunning second-half goals from Patrick Dorgu and ⁠Matheus Cunha.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: U.S. rock climber Alex Honnold reaches top of Taipei 101 skyscraper without ropes
events.description: Cheers erupted from a street-level crowd as Alex Honnold reached the top of the spire of the 508-meter (1,667-foot) tower, about 90 minutes after he started.

events.title: Greenland, tariffs and NATO: a rollercoaster week in transatlantic relations
events.description: After President Trump's upheaval at Davos, U.S. allies are openly questioning whether Washington can still anchor the rules-based order.

events.title: Danish community reacts to Trump's rhetoric around Greenland
events.description: Danish citizens say President Trump's latest push to control Greenland is changing their view on Denmark's relationship with America.

events.title: Ukraine says US security guarantees deal '100% ready'
events.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the US deal on security guarantees for Ukraine is completely ready, and Kyiv is simply waiting for a time and place to sign it.

events.title: Russia looks to India to fill labor shortage
events.description: Russia needs workers — and is now hiring in India. Why Moscow is shifting its migration strategy, and what awaits Indians arriving in Russia.

events.title: US officials, Netanyahu discuss 2nd phase of Gaza peace plan
events.description: The plan involves the reopening the Rafah border crossing, a critical lifeline for Palestinians in Gaza. Israel has maintained it will not advance to the second phase until the remains of the last hostage are returned.

events.title: Saudi defense deals could change Middle East security
events.description: Riyadh is in talks with Somalia, Egypt and Turkey about two new defense pacts. What impact will they have if they go ahead?

events.title: What you can do to bypass authoritarian surveillance
events.description: How can people use the internet in authoritarian countries like China, Russia and Iran without revealing their identity? Are there workarounds besides VPNs and proxy servers?

events.title: Alex Honnold: US man free climbs Taiwan's 101-story tower
events.description: Spiderman called in sick, so Alex Hannold scaled the Taipei 101 — all without ropes, safety nets or spidey webs. Taiwan's president congratulated Honnold on completing the challenge.

events.title: EU, India set for historic trade deal amid US tariffs
events.description: In what's been called a victory for free trade, the EU and India are set to agree on "the mother of all deals" and a defense pact that aims to lure India away from its close political and military ties to Russia.

events.title: Japan returns last 2 pandas to China amid strained ties
events.description: Large crowds have visited Ueno Zoo in Tokyo to say farewell to two pandas that are about to go back to China. Their departure means Japan will be panda-less for the first time in half a century.

events.title: US–EU economic ties show why neither side can decouple
events.description: Despite a pause in tariff escalation, US–EU trade remains volatile under Donald Trump. From deficits and energy to services and the dollar, the trans-Atlantic relationship reveals deep ties — and clear vulnerabilities.

events.title: Tanzania's Maasai, wildlife corridor face growing pressure
events.description: Trophy hunting interests are turning the screw on northern Tanzania's Maasai communities and wildlife paradise. Meanwhile, well-funded conservation efforts are attracting scrutiny amid rising Maasai eviction cases.

events.title: In Greenland, US-NATO deal met with relief, mistrust
events.description: A "framework" agreement between the US and NATO has defused the dispute over Greenland. There is cautious relief among residents, but also fear of once again becoming a geopolitical pawn.

events.title: Ukraine: Zelenskyy calls Abu Dhabi talks 'constructive'
events.description: The Ukrainian president said the talks with Russia and the US could resume "as early as next week." Meanwhile, Russian missiles have hit Kyiv and Kharkiv, killing one person. DW has more.

events.title: France set to fast track under-15s social media ban
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron wants to fast-track legislation to ban social media for teens under the age of 15, with parliament slated to vote on a draft proposal Monday.

events.title: Polls close in Myanmar's junta-run elections with army set for victory
events.description: Voting finished in Myanmar's three-stage general election on Sunday with the dominant pro-military party on course for a landslide victory in a junta-run vote that critics say was neither free nor democratic, and designed to legitimize the military's rule.

events.title: Trump praises 'very brave' UK troops after fury over Afghanistan remarks
events.description: Donald Trump has praised "very brave" British soldiers who served in Afghanistan after fierce criticism of his claim non-US troops had stayed back from the frontline.

events.title: China no longer America's top defence priority, Pentagon says
events.description: China is no longer the US Pentagon's top priority, shifting its focus to the homeland and Western Hemisphere, an influential new strategy document says.

events.title: Novak Djokovic apologises after ball nearly hits ball girl at Australian Open
events.description: Novak Djokovic has apologised after almost hitting a ball girl with the ball during his history-making Australian Open third-round match on Saturday.

events.title: Ugandan opposition leader claims wife held 'at gunpoint' after 'hundreds of soldiers' raided his home
events.description: Uganda's opposition leader claims "hundreds of soldiers" raided his home overnight and held his wife at gunpoint, leaving destruction everywhere.

events.title: US security agreement for Ukraine is '100% ready' to be signed, Zelenskyy says
events.description: Zelenskyy said Ukraine is waiting for its partners to set a signing date.

events.title: France detains captain of suspected Russian 'shadow fleet' tanker seized in Mediterranean
events.description: The captain of an oil tanker intercepted by the French navy in the Mediterranean Sea is in custody for questioning

events.title: Row erupts within UK's Labour Party after popular mayor blocked from election
events.description: Critics claim that Prime Minister Starmer did not want to see a potential rival.

events.title: Getting to 'no': Europe's leaders find a way to speak with one voice against Trump
events.description: European leaders are finding a way to speak with one voice against President Donald Trump and they're increasingly willing to say “no” to his demands

events.title: France's Macron pushes for fast-track ban on social media for children under 15
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron says he wants to fast-track a ban on social media for teenagers under 15

events.title: Trump's Greenland ambitions strain MAGA ties with Europe's far-right
events.description: Tensions over U.S. President Donald Trump's plans to control Greenland have caused a rift between MAGA and Europe's far-right

events.title: Myanmar holds its last election round with the army already certain to keep control over government
events.description: Voting has begun in the final round of Myanmar’s general election, concluding a monthlong process

events.title: Hermès menswear designer Nichanian takes final bow after 37 years
events.description: With Paris Fashion Week menswear heading into its final weekend, Hermès marked a transition as Véronique Nichanian presented her final men’s collection after 37 years leading the house’s menswear

events.title: The last two pandas in Japan are leaving for China as ties are strained
events.description: Japanese panda fans have seen their beloved pandas return to China over the past decades, but bidding farewell to beloved twins Xiao Xiao and Lei Lei at Sunday’s final public viewing at Tokyo’s Ueno zoo is especially emotional

events.title: Iraq’s dominant political bloc nominates former prime minister al-Maliki as its candidate
events.description: Iraq’s dominant political bloc has nominated former prime minister Nouri al-Maliki as its candidate for prime minister

events.title: From family farm to climate tech: How one Kenyan woman is helping farmers outsmart drought
events.description: “Giving up is not an option - so many people depend on you,” the words of Maryanne Gichanga, a participant in a UN supported initiative, which aims to help farmers in Kenya find solutions to alleviate the pressures of climate change on agriculture production.

events.title: Cold kills another infant in Gaza as West Bank displacement intensifies
events.description: Another child in the Gaza Strip has died from hypothermia as winter weather continues to whip the enclave, the UN said on Wednesday, citing information from the health authorities.

events.title: Texas cult in crosshairs of killer mom’s bathtub slayings case as questions hang over family horror
events.description: New documentary explores shocking allegations that Andrea Yates was influenced by religious cult before drowning her five children in 2001 Texas tragedy.

events.title: Baltimore bloodshed drops as law-and-order push targets repeat criminals
events.description: Baltimore homicides plummet to 134 in 2025, down from 334 in 2022, as prosecutors target repeat violent offenders with aggressive sentencing strategies.

events.title: Elizabeth Smart reveals her kidnapper tried to abduct her teen cousin as his ‘next wife’
events.description: Elizabeth Smart reveals her captor Brian David Mitchell planned to kidnap her cousin Olivia Wright as his second "wife" during her nine-month captivity.

events.title: Macron says children's brains are 'not for sale,' urges fast-track to ban social media for kids under 15
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron pushes lawmakers to ban social media for kids under 15, saying children's emotions won't be manipulated by "American Platforms" or "Chinese algorithms."

events.title: Russian oil tanker, the Grinch, intercepted as US, allies escalate sanctions crackdown
events.description: A Russian oil tanker was intercepted between Spain and Morocco as western powers intensify efforts to disrupt Moscow's sanctions-evading shadow fleet operations.

events.title: American OnlyFans star with Mexican cartel ties kidnapped at gunpoint outside mall
events.description: An Arizona OnlyFans star was allegedly kidnapped at gunpoint in Mexico, according to video. Nicole Pardo Molina's abduction may be linked to a cartel rivalry in Sinaloa.

events.title: ISIS fighters still at large after Syrian prison break, contributing to volatile security situation
events.description: ISIS prisoners escaped from a northeastern Syria prison, and some remain unaccounted for after chaos made tracking impossible, according to Syria analyst Nanar Hawach.

events.title: Denmark's prime minister insists sovereignty is non-negotiable as Trump announces Greenland deal 'framework'
events.description: Denmark's prime minister said she won't negotiate her nation's sovereignty after President Donald Trump said a "framework" on a Greenland deal was reached.
